title: VINCE – Virtual Integration Home
description: Bachelor's Thesis project. A virtual integration home system focusing on modular avatars and UI architecture.

details.challenge: Creating an efficient avatar system that allows for runtime customization without performance penalties on mobile hardware.
details.solution: Designed a ScriptableObject database and mask-based shader workflow (RGBA) for efficient recoloring and reduced draw calls. Built a mobile-friendly editor with dynamic lists.

title: AI Enemy System (Prototype)
description: A personal prototype focusing on FSM frameworks and perception systems for game AI.

details.challenge: Building a generic, reusable state machine that can handle complex enemy behaviors like patrolling, chasing, and wariness.
details.solution: Implemented a generic state machine with concrete states (Patrol, Chase, Wary). Created a layered perception system with FOV checks and sphere casts.

title: Dialogue System
description: A data-driven dialogue system with branching narratives and quest integration.

details.challenge: Decoupling dialogue logic from game world state while allowing for complex branching and quest hooks.
details.solution: Used ScriptableObject definitions for nodes. Built a decoupled event system connecting dialogue to gold, shops, and quest logic.

title: Volumetric Cloud Renderer
description: A highly optimized ray-marching shader for volumetric clouds. Written in HLSL.

details.challenge: Rendering volumetric clouds in real-time on mid-range hardware without dropping below 60fps.
details.solution: Implemented temporal reprojection and half-resolution rendering. Used 3D noise textures generated in Substance Designer for shape definition.

title: Stylized Water Shader
description: Zelda-inspired water shader including depth-based color absorption.

details.challenge: Replicating the specific stylized look of Nintendo games while maintaining flexibility for different lighting conditions.
details.solution: Used the Camera Depth Texture to calculate water depth for absorption effects. Added Gerstner waves for vertex displacement.

title: Sci-Fi Mecha Model
description: Hard-surface character model. High-poly sculpted in ZBrush, textured in Substance.

details.challenge: Creating a highly detailed mech that is rigged for animation and optimized for game engines.
details.solution: Used a boolean workflow in Blender for hard surface forms. Baked high-poly normals onto a low-poly mesh with weighted normals for perfect shading.
